definition: to hug/to embrace/to hold in one's arms
to draw towards oneself/to gather/to gather up (one's gown, sleeves etc)/to grab (money)/to extort
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
surname Lou/one of the 28 lunar mansions in Chinese astronomy
to shake out/to bring to light/to squander
to pile together/to cram food into one's mouth (with chopsticks)/to eat fast
to hold in one's arms/to embrace
(coll.) to grab money/to rake in money

sentences.english: She clasped her sister's waist, and together they descended the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 她紧搂着姐姐的腰，一起走下楼去。

sentences.english: The wife who becomes an emperor a full blood the greatly hugs in the bosom, pain not the desire living.

sentences.english: Out of his trance Jim seemed quickly to wake. He enfolded his Della.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆好像从恍惚之中醒来，把德拉紧紧地搂在怀里。

sentences.english: The summer rather embraces the body that the keeping of river vegetable spirit tremble in the bosom.

sentences.english: We were freezing, and I put my arm around her.

sentences.english: He enfolded the child in an affectionate embrace.
sentences.chinese: 他疼爱那孩子而紧紧搂在怀里。

sentences.english: He clung to Blondin's leg and the rope in order not to fall.

sentences.english: And he took his wife in his arms, and looked at her with anguish.
sentences.chinese: 他搂着妻子，悲痛地望着她。

sentences.english: By now they've sized each other up. I wonder if he's still pissing in his pants.

sentences.english: “No!” barked the head nurse, who waswrapped around Linda’s neck. “I thinkshe can do it.”
sentences.chinese: 护士长搂着琳达的脖子大喊，“我相信她能做到。”

sentences.english: My gaze fell to the nape of his neck where my hand is.
sentences.chinese: 我的手搂着他的脖子，目光注视着他的颈背。

sentences.english: We walked out on the dance floor and held each other awkwardly.

to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish
